definition: to arrange/to exhibit/to move to and fro/a pendulum

sentences.english: He boated some bags of rice across the river.
sentences.chinese: 他将几袋大米摆渡过河。

sentences.english: But the Red Army got the only boat and heroically went over.
sentences.chinese: 可是红军得到了唯一的一只摆渡，英勇地渡过了河。

sentences.english: The ferryboat will take you over.
sentences.chinese: 渡船又回到镇口摆渡去了。

sentences.english: The old man boated me across the river.
In Charon's palm it pay the toll to Death.
sentences.chinese: 在摆渡人的掌中支付了通向死亡的旅费。

sentences.english: Boat cover Chuan Peng, ferry passengers.
This ferry bus is full, another one will come here immediately.
sentences.chinese: 这俩摆渡车已经满了，另一部马上来。

sentences.english: To provide vehicles ferry and guidance for customers.
sentences.chinese: 为走机坪通道的贵宾提供车辆摆渡或引导。

sentences.english: Ferries connect one to the smaller islands.
sentences.chinese: 摆渡船是连接这些岛屿和各个小岛的交通工具。

sentences.english: (UN001), thank you, please arrange passenger stairs and shuttle buses for us.
sentences.chinese: 谢谢，请安排客梯车和摆渡车。

sentences.english: After the car ferry to return to their homes warm.
sentences.chinese: 后可车摆渡返回温馨家园。

sentences.english: We go to Pudong by ferry.
He sidefooted the ball in from close range after Thierry Henry had headed across a free-kick.
sentences.chinese: 他在接应亨利的头球摆渡后破门得分。

sentences.english: Instead of walking you can take this shuttle get you there faster.
sentences.chinese: 别走路，你可以搭机场的摆渡车到那里，这样比较快。

sentences.english: Charon transported the souls of the dead to the kingdom of the god of the dead , Pluto.
sentences.chinese: 卡隆是摆渡亡灵到冥王普路托地界的神。

sentences.english: They teased him to ferry them over the river.
sentences.chinese: 他们一再请求他把他们摆渡过河。

definition: to scull (with a single oar, usually mounted on the stern of the boat)
open sluice gate/(toll) station/boarding gate (airport etc)/(fig.) gateway (access point)
area in the Shangcheng district of Hangzhou
boat propelled by a yuloh (a single sculling oar)
(of a boat) to reach the shore/to pull toward shore/close to shore/landfall
